Marking as WORKSFORME

Created an attachment (id=63233)
Log showing exception produced by my steps

I ran into a very similar exception.  I can reproduce it in HEAD as of 4/8/2007 with the following steps:

1. Start Eclipse on a new workspace.
2. Create a Java project called "myproject".
3. Create a main class called "MyClass" and leave the main method empty.
4. Right-click MyClass.java -> Run As -> Java Application.  This creates a launch configuration.
5. Run -> Open Run Dialog.  Select the MyClass configuration.  On the Common tab, make the configuration shared at path "/myproject".  Click Apply and then Close.
6. Right-click myproject -> Properties -> Builders.  Add a new external tool builder of type Program for the command "/bin/sleep 30".  Press OK as necessary.
7. Project -> Build All.  The external tool builder starts to run.  Click Run in Background.
8. Run -> Open Run Dialog.  Select the MyClass configuration.  On the Arguments tab, type "foo" as a program argument.
9. Click Apply.  Nothing happens.
10. Click Close.  At the prompt about discarding changes, click Yes.  A "User Operation Is Waiting" dialog appears, showing "Run" (i.e., the change to the launch configuration) blocked by "Building Workspace".
11. When the dialog goes away, a stack trace is written to the log (attached).

Someone please reopen the bug, or tell me if I should enter a new bug with this information.
Not sure how the Debug team handles this, but I'll reopen the bug for now.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 112081 ***
